intro: Galatella punctata var. viscosa, commonly known as the sticky galatella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and stems, which give it a sticky texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
